name: Rodrigo Alves
bio:
Rodrigo Alves became known worldwide for his courage in reinventing himself with the help of plastic surgery. This has given him the confidence to express himself with a unique fashion style, and has led him to be happy to enjoy life and a better lifestyle. He is now outgoing, charismatic, and a truly passionate ambassador for the subjects of body image, plastic surgery, fashion, body image bulling, and equality. 

Rodrigo Alves has appeared on 46 TV shows to date, including reality and documentary shows worldwide. Rodrigo's good expressive interpersonal and language skills enable him to reach various countries and cultures very successfully, sharing his experiences with plastic surgery, educating people from his own experiences, and also sharing his great sense of fashion. 

Rodrigo loves an excuse to party, and dresses elegantly to attend events and parties. He can be often seen in Las Vegas, Los Angeles, London and Puerto Banús hanging out with his group of friends always very chatty and charming. Rodrigo stands out not only for his unique but classic fashion style but also for his kind, warm and friendly personality which has won him fans all over the world.

name: Emma
bio:
Hi you! My name is Emma and I'm 25 years old. I'm born and raised in The Netherlands. I'm having MS & Lyme Disease and I'm traveling the world for treatments. While doing treatments I'm more determined than ever to rise and shine, and definitely not letting my diseases define me. I did a lot of collaborations for over the past years, and I think because of my illnesses I am a really hard working woman and not letting ANYTHING come in my way if I want to achieve it. I want to show my followers that Fashion is fun and you can do so much with it, as well with beauty and health products. 
What you see is what you get with me, my previous clients from collaborations were immediately positive when I send them my pictures, and I'm always updating them whenever I got the product and if I'm having pictures ready etc. I'm doing everything myself, from the creative part of where to shoot, the modeling part, the editing, just everything you can think of. 
For different treatments for my health, I lived in Florida (Tampa/Clearwater Beach Area) and in Los Angeles. I loved living in such different cities, it inspires me and I learned a lot from it. 
I'm also graduated as a Nutritionist, so my passions really are Fashion, Beauty and Health. I'm now back in the Netherlands, and I'm pregnant with our first child! 
Do you want to see more? Please send an email so I can send you my portfolio! Would love to hear from you! - Emma

LC’s Closet originally started out as a fashion blog to help me escape the stress of Ph.D. life. While still predominantly a personal style blog, since I waved goodbye to academic life and moved to the US my little spot in cyber space has grown to incorporate lifestyle and blog advice content too. So I guess the ‘closet’ now contains everything including the kitchen sink.

name: Sunny Gu
bio:
My name is Sunny Gu, a Los Angeles-based fashion & beauty illustrator. 

I have been commissioned by the likes of Condé Nast, Vogue Magazine, Teen Vogue, ELLE Magazine , InStyle, Bloomingdales, Macy's, Nordstrom, Versace, Dolce & Gabbana's Swide Magazine, Carolina Herrera, Brian Atwood, Express, South Coast Plaza, Beverly Center,The Grove, La Prairie, Shiseido, FANCL , Neutrogena and HBO among others. 

I was born and raised in China, I moved to the United States when I was 13. After encountering people from different backgrounds, I became very curious about other cultures. I learned to observe and discover beauties in everything around me. 

I wish to find a way to capture and preserve the beauties that I see, the kindness that I feel, and recreate them in someway. I decided to become an illustrator and artist. 

For most of my illustrations, I paint them in watercolor. I love the vibrancy and unpredictable nature of watercolor. Occasionally I use graphite or acrylic paint to render some special textures. I also create digital art for surface design and textiles. 

My illustrations are always full of vibrant colors, rich details and delightful feelings. My work, on the other hand, is an endless journey searching for beauty, value, truth and self. When I paint, I am bathed in happiness, I hope my colorful illustrations can bring you some joy too! 

Wish you a wonderful day! 

Sunny

name: TUESDAY VINTAGE ☆☆☆
bio:
Tuesday vintage is an online creative platform where founder and stylist, Rachel March showcases the innovative work of herself and other creatives alike whilst also doubling as a store selling unique fashion forward vintage pieces. 
Each piece has a story of it’s own - recycled, retold and relived in every new home that it enters. 

Born in 2012, Tuesday Vintage now ranges a wide variety of creative work including styling, full directed shoots, brand collaborations, lookbooks & design. 
Rachel’s extensive set of skills in styling are now being used to collaborate with the many artists in this world where they will then be featured on the blog, exposing viewers to upcoming trends and talent to keep an eye on. 

The store heavily relies on trend forecasts where the seasonal vintage buys reflect up to date fashion movements whilst remaining unique and one of a kind. 
Rachel’s coordination with designers, labels, style icons, photographers, bloggers and PR companies across the globe ensures that the shop will forever offer eccentric pieces like no other and the Tuesday Vintage platform will constantly be showcasing the best of the best. 

Much like most age old tales - there is a beginning, a middle and an end. 
For Tuesday Vintage, this is only the beginning. 

Thankful to everyone who has joined this wild adventure, Rachel truly believes it's all of the people she has met along the way that keeps this inspiration and magic growing.. ♡

name: Lindsi Lane•So|Lindsi
bio:
Lindsi Lane is on a mission to prove that with the right outfit, a good attitude and a sense of humor, anything is possible. The New York City-based writer is the founder of lifestyle website, SoLindsi.com, a carefully curated edit of personal stories, satirical commentary, and outfit inspiration. Lindsi draws upon her fashion background and straight-shooting persona to create Humor with a Sense of Style. 

The Indiana University-grad began her fashion career working for Gucci, Michael Kors, and Elle magazine, before becoming the youngest personal shopper in Barney’s New York history at age 23. She went on to form styling company, Lindsi Michelle Lane LLC, and was signed as the first ‘By Appointment’ stylist for Ford Artists NYC. Despite her successful styling career, Lindsi was eager to show others that personal style extends far beyond the clothing on your back. 

In 2015, she launched SoLindsi.com to connect with readers as a digital hybrid of their best friend and stylist. “Style is how you paint your blank canvas, but your voice is the essence of your personal style,” says Lindsi, who empowers readers with her quick-witted charm and honest content – think Sex and the City meets Amy Schumer. “My mission is to inspire people to be comfortable in their own skin, embrace who they are beyond the surface, and laugh along the way.” 

SoLindsi.com is a lifestyle website best known for its Humor with a Sense of Style. Creator, Lindsi Lane shares personal narratives, candid advice with her Ask Lindsi column, fashion finds, and relationship advice to help readers develop a bold, eccentric style that celebrates originality and cultivates confidence. Her witty perspective and relatable point of view sets the site apart from others in the digital space. SoLindsi.com offers behind-the-scenes access to Lindsi’s endless adventures and guides readers toward living the life of their dreams in style from the inside out.”

name: Nathalie Madsen | Influencer from NL
bio:
Hi there! 

I'm Nathalie, a professional and experienced Digital Influencer, based in The Netherlands, but with a large international following base worldwide. 

As a current Digital Influencer / micro blogger, an official brand ambassador for Sheree Cosmetics, Rosefield and Soque and a former beauty, fashion and lifestyle blogger (I used to own an international high quality blog for several years), I'm highly experienced in writing reviews and working together with brands and webshops. During my blogging days, I've teamed up with multiple national and international beauty, fashion and lifestyle brands and shops, including RealHer Cosmetics, Dicharitzi, Havaianas, Bondi Sands and IWhite Teeth Whitening. I didn't want to give up blogging, so I decided to post my well written, honest and thorough reviews to Instagram and became a succesful micro blogger / Instagram influencer instead. By switching from being a blogger to being an Influencer, I was able to keep doing what I loved doing the most: blogging, helping others making decisions when buying beauty, fashion and lifestyle related items, having fun and talking and engaging with my lovely worldwide audience! 

More recently I've finished several Instagram collaborations with Civilised Cosmetics, Frosteewhite, Snowfox Skincare, VitaJuwel Bottles, BeNatural Organics, Tyes By Tara, MakeUpDrop, Soque, Fashion and Trends, SkinMud, Misfit Elements, Cocoa Locks, and iDeal Of Sweden, to name a few. The final results are on my Instagram page now, which you can find in the Social Media links above this bio. I'm also one of the brand new official brand ambassadors for Sheree Cosmetics, a new natural and cruelty free cosmetic brand, for Rosefield Watches and for Soque, a funny socks webshop, and I'm in the middle of multiple other new collaborations with beauty, fashion and lifestyle brands. Yes, I'm a busy girl!   I'm getting excellent feedback from brands and shops, after working with them. I've been told several times I'm one of the most professional Influencers they've been working with and I'm told my photography is very pretty and professional too. 

I'm a huge beauty, fashion and health fan, and so is my audience. Not only do I love products that make me look and feel fashionable, healthy and beautiful, I also closely watch my ecological footprint and encourage my followers to do the same by posting about the environment and sustainability. I'm trying to make the world a better place, one step at a time. I love to show the world my take on beauty, fashion, health and sustainability and my go-to stores and webshops, my ideas, my style and my routines. 

If you take a look at my Social Media accounts all together, you'll see I can count on 10.000+ lovely followers of all ages, genders and countries worldwide. Concerning my Instagram account, with an average of 90+ likes and 30+ comments a post, I have a engagement rating of over 7% and I always use multiple relevant hashtags and a nametag to accompany my attractive looking pictures or video's and I also use 1 particular and personal hashtag to group all my reviews: use #natjesreviews in your search to see and read all of my reviews at once. I use personal hastags for showing my product swatches, my outfits, my makeup looks and my beauty related stash too. Yes, every topic has it's own personal hashtag, which is an easy and convenient way to simplify all your searches!  Anyway, I also share my Instagram reviews to Pinterest and Twitter, to ensure a maximum amount of exposure worldwide. As you can see, all together, I have a followingbase of over 10.000 active and loyal fans. All my Social Media accounts are public and written in English. And if you rather want me to write a review directly on your website (or both your website and my social media), or any other website like Trustpilot, that's also a possibility. Let me put it this way: when collaborating with me, almost anything is possible!  

Last but not least: I usually work on a gifting base, which means I don't get paid for my work as an influencer. Here's how it works: you send me the product or products you like me to review for free and in return, I write a honest and thorough review to promote your webshop or brand to my followers, also for free. The only thing I ask for, in return for the hard work I'm putting in writing this review, is for me to keep the product I'm reviewing / promoting, because that way, it's the most beneficial for the both of us. My ultimate goal isn't just providing my followers with quality content, but also building a longlasting relationship with the brand, providing them with new customers and beautiful pictures they can use on their own pages and website! 

Well, that's about it I guess. If you have any questions, concerns, thoughts or ideas, feel free to contact me! 

I hope we can collaborate and I love to hear from you soon. 

Thanks for reading and have a nice day! 

Love, 
Nathalie

name: Pari
bio:
Hi! I am Pari. I am an avid traveler, a k-drama fan, a wife and a fashionable nerd. 

I was born with a wanderlust that I had no means of satisfying. Growing up I had one thing going for me - I was slightly above average in academics. So, I worked hard thinking that education would open doors for me... and it did! I traveled to many countries to attend and present at conferences.However, secretly I wished to skip the conference and explore the beautiful city I had traveled to. 

After the PhD I had two choices: academia or travel. For a year I chose the safe option: academia. It did not fulfill me. So, here I am taking the biggest risk of my life, jumping in head first into becoming a full time travel and fashion influencer and blogger. 

Through my stories and pictures, I hope to inspire others to travel more and live their dream. I am eager to work with brands in the travel and fashion industry that inspire people and spread a positive message.

bio:

I timidly started my Instagram profile about a year ago, sharing modeling and fashion photos that you would not find on the typical middle/high school student's Instagram. I got more and more serious, and with that, I took my fashion blog, "The Thread Collision," to the next level of professionalism. 

Another thing I embarked on was starting my Youtube channel, something I have literally wanted to do for years and years. I have learned so much about myself through my time here on social media, and I absolutely love creating content- whether it be in the form of photos, text, or videos. 

I invite you to join me on my social media journey! Feel free to reach out at any time! 

You can find me on snapchat via rachelniccolai and just about any social media by that name!

name: Heidi Mary Jane Ferguson
bio:
I'm an Australian model who now mainly works with musicians and comedians in a booking and managerial role, as well as promoting events, brands and businesses whilst based out of Los Angeles. 
I relocated to the United States in 2017, and have previously lived all over Australia and in New Zealand. As a result of my work and travel, my reach is strong across the U.S.A, Canada, Europe, Australia and New Zealand. 
I'm vegan, health and fitness focused and my instagram is lifestyle-focused - it shows much of what I eat, the adventures I go on, and the style and beauty choices that I make. 
I carefully consider any and all sponsorships as maintaining authenticity is essential to both my personal brand, and that of companies I endorse. 
I have successfully boosted exposure for many small businesses, designers and movements. Some of my most engaged followers are other public figures that are friends of mine - with anywhere between 2-5 million followers each. 
I have experience in marketing both from working within the fashion, advertising and promotional industry as a model and event manager, and also from managing businesses myself, being the person responsible for their entire social media and advertising campaigns.

bio:

I created Life to Lauren to document the things that I love. My mission is to use this blog as a platform to help women feel beautiful, to be an honest voice and friendly face.I believe in living the healthiest and happiest life possible, all while looking and feeling your best. This is a concept I hope to teach my readers. 

I share with the Life to Lauren community every single aspect of my life, from real-life personal experiences, to my favorite fashion trends, fitness tips, healthy recipes that I cannot stop making, decor ideas and more.

bio: Stylishly curating the modern southern experience through entertaining, travel & cooking. Darling Down South is a Southern Life well explored. Since Darling Down South was created over 3 years ago, it has quickly risen to a trusted source for dining, travel, and daily inspiration for a network of over 50K heavily concentrated in the SouthEastern United States but with a global reach as well. Darling Down South specializes in curating stories that are informative and inspiring in our four main pillars: food, travel, style, and home. From hosting your own dinner party in style, to travel guides of great Southern cities, Cynthia curates an experience for all Southern enthusiasts to relate to and engage with on Darling Down South.

The focus is kept on sharing timeless and worthy content, staying true to myself.

name: Kid Chris
bio:
Globetrotter Kid Chris excites audiences in Europe, Asia, Africa and the USA in more than 60 countries, hundreds of cities with more than 150 gigs each year.. The selection of clubs, venues and festivals he performed, as a headline Dj is endless. He is the dj of the successful event series “In Bed with Space World Tour”. Born, raised and based in Cologne/ Germany, he loves to travels the world, always bringing good music and happiness with him. 
With his inimitable and pushing sound, he animates and excites every party crowd all over the globe. An irresistible mix of high quality and uplifting electronic dance music. The unique Kid Chris Sound is Ibiza influenced and combined with high energy club anthems and his breathtaking vocalist and mc live performance. 
The start of the year 2012 was more than perfect for Kid Chris. His upcoming single “Stardust” is signed to one of the world’s leading Dance Labels “WE PLAY” and killer melody peak time anthem (release coming soon). Since March 2012 in stores: The Kid Chris remix of the all time House Music Classic: “Mighty Dub Katz – Magic Carpet Ride”. The alter ego behind the Mighty Dub Katz is no one else than the Musician “Norman Cook” aka “FATBOY SLIM”. The remix is part of Fatboy Slim’s new Mix Album “Dance Harder Bitch”. Back in 2007 Kid Chris’ debut Single “South Beach” was a huge club anthem, supported by dj's such as Paul van Dyk, Roger Sanchez, Micha Moor and many more others. Kid Chris remixed Fat Boy Slim/ Mighty Dub Katz, Barbara Tucker, Lissat & Voltaxx, Alexandra Prince, Plastik Funk and the German pop act “Rosenstolz” to name a few. With success: His interpretation of the Prodigy Remake „No Good“ from Sean Finn (WE PLAY), took place for 5 weeks on chart position #1 of the german dance charts in summer 2011. Furthermore his Remix “Gib mir Sonne” from Rosenstolz (August 2008) reached the billboard chart position #1 in Germany, Switzerland and Austria and has Gold Status. 
World leading Dance Music Labels by way of example: Ministry of Sound, Toolroom, We Play, Universal, Milk & Sugar, Pacha Recordings (Ibiza), Blanco Y Negro, Ultra Rec., Southern Fried Rec., and more signed Kid Chris for releases, remixes and compilations with great success and chart placements in Europe, Asia, U.A.E., Russia and U.S.A.. 
His music productions are featured on compilations: 
Dance Harder Bitch – mixed by Fatboy Slim (Mighty Dub Katz – Magic Carpet Ride – Kid Chris & Brian Cribbs Remix), Big FM Tronic Love mixed by Hanna Hansen: (Sean Finn - No Good – Kid Chris Remix), Ministry of Sound The Annual (Geo da Silva – I’ll do it like a Truck – Kid Chris Remix), Cream Ibiza, Mixed by Paul van Dyk (Kid Chris – South Beach- Original), Pure Pacha Ibiza and Pacha Ibiza VIP Vol. 2 (Mixed by Sarah Main: Guernica – Darkness - Kid Chris Remix) to mention some references. 
October 2008 Kid Chris released his first mix compilation album “In Touch with Ibiza Vol. 1“ (Clubstar Rec.). The CD was a huge success and sold out in a few month. “In Touch with Ibiza Vol. 2“ in 2009 and Vol. 3 in 2010 followed. All Cd’s were bestseller’s in Music stores around the world and took place in the Beatport, Amazon and Itunes Sale Charts. In 2011 Kid Chris released the Mix Album „“In Bed with Space Vol. 14“ together with the world famous Dj Duo “Dabruck & Klein“. The Cd was also a bestseller. Two new mix albums are planned for the year 2012. 
Kid Chris performed alongside the biggest names of the scene: David Guetta, Fedde le Grand, Snoop Dog, Eddie Thoneick, Michael Gray, Pete Tong, John Dahlback, Barbara Tucker, Jerome Ismaee, Carl Cox, Erick Morillo, David Morales, Todd Terry, Westbam, Lexy & K. Paul, Michael Gray, Eddie Thoneick, D.o.n.s., Milk and Sugar, Disco Boys, Kurd Maverick, Dabruck & Klein, Dj Antoine and many more. 
Regular Gigs in the most famous and extravagant clubs around the globe: Space Club and Privilege Ibiza (Spain), Pacha Marrakesh (Morocco), Velvet and Cocoon Club in Frankfurt (Germany), Set Club and Club 50 Viceroy in Miami (U.S.A.), Attica (Singapore), Bed Supper Club in Bangkok (Thailand), Sankeys Manchester and That Club London in (U.K.), SPACEdance in Mykonos (Greece), Answer Club in Seoul (South Korea), Aquarius club Zrce and Zagreb (Croatia), Panama in Amsterdam (Holland), Loft in Malaysia (Kuala Lumpur), Halikarnas in Bodrum (Turkey), Chillout Club Luanda (Angola) (extracts). 
Furthermore for events as follows: In Bed With Space, in Touch With Ibiza, The Original White Party from Amsterdam, Ministry of Sound Club Tour (Germany), MTV Becks Gold Tour, MTV Kia Soul Tour, MTV Asia (Live in Singapore), MTV Austria (Music and Style/ Donauinselfest), Viva TV (Style Nights) and Viva Club Rotation (Poland, U.K., Germany and Spain, Ibiza), Rich Glamour Night (Rich Prosecco) and of course in the course the world’s most important conference for electronic dance music: Winter Music Conference in Miami USA and Amsterdam Dance Event in Holland, Europe.

name: M E L A N I E  P A C E
bio:
Melanie Pace is a distinguished fashion advisor, on-air style expert, and wardrobe stylist born and raised in The Sunshine State. Frequently featured on panels as a style virtuoso, her strengths include editorial styling (print, TV, photo and video), event hosting, covering red carpets, and consulting on wardrobes for private clients.

The Florida State University alumna plunged into the fashion industry as a visual merchandiser with Anthropologie. A year later, with a degree in both Fashion Merchandising and Business, Melanie began her own styling and wardrobe consulting business and has been trailblazing the industry ever since. 

When she launched her blog, she did so as a means to connect with her newfound fanbase; grant them access to her fashionable findings and give insight to her thoughts on living an empowered life. Covering a multitude of topics such as fitness, beauty, travel, and interior design – Melanie’s blog has offered readers guidance and inspiration towards achieving their own goals, all from a strikingly relatable perspective. Her style is dynamic; it’s desired and accessible, and her ability to create current looks with any budget sets her apart from the rest.

name: Kati - food • travel • food
bio:
I’m a photographer, food enthusiast and travel lover born in Germany. I love to share my adventures and tasty finds I eat at home and away. I’ve travelled to 5 continents, lived in 9 countries and toured 64 nations. From freshly baked empanadas in Argentina to spicy curries in India and green tea ice cream in Japan I’ve always enjoyed documenting new taste experiences. 
Now I’m living in Istanbul and when I’m not cuddling my cats, you can find me wandering hidden back alleys or devouring Turkish treats. 

black.white.vivid. is a colorful lifestyle blog curated by Kati for the curious traveler and healthy foodie. A love story between images and words, Kati's travel adventures take readers to unknown places, local eats and happy moments. 
Aiming to capture the interest for travelling and foreign cultures, the blog curates food guides from around the world as well as recipes inspired by Kati’s travels.

name: Rodrigo Alves
bio:
Rodrigo Alves became known worldwide for his courage in reinventing himself with the help of plastic surgery. This has given him the confidence to express himself with a unique fashion style, and has led him to be happy to enjoy life and a better lifestyle. He is now outgoing, charismatic, and a truly passionate ambassador for the subjects of body image, plastic surgery, fashion, body image bulling, and equality. 

Rodrigo Alves has appeared on 46 TV shows to date, including reality and documentary shows worldwide. Rodrigo's good expressive interpersonal and language skills enable him to reach various countries and cultures very successfully, sharing his experiences with plastic surgery, educating people from his own experiences, and also sharing his great sense of fashion. 

Rodrigo loves an excuse to party, and dresses elegantly to attend events and parties. He can be often seen in Las Vegas, Los Angeles, London and Puerto Banús hanging out with his group of friends always very chatty and charming. Rodrigo stands out not only for his unique but classic fashion style but also for his kind, warm and friendly personality which has won him fans all over the world.

name: Emma
bio:
Hi you! My name is Emma and I'm 25 years old. I'm born and raised in The Netherlands. I'm having MS & Lyme Disease and I'm traveling the world for treatments. While doing treatments I'm more determined than ever to rise and shine, and definitely not letting my diseases define me. I did a lot of collaborations for over the past years, and I think because of my illnesses I am a really hard working woman and not letting ANYTHING come in my way if I want to achieve it. I want to show my followers that Fashion is fun and you can do so much with it, as well with beauty and health products. 
What you see is what you get with me, my previous clients from collaborations were immediately positive when I send them my pictures, and I'm always updating them whenever I got the product and if I'm having pictures ready etc. I'm doing everything myself, from the creative part of where to shoot, the modeling part, the editing, just everything you can think of. 
For different treatments for my health, I lived in Florida (Tampa/Clearwater Beach Area) and in Los Angeles. I loved living in such different cities, it inspires me and I learned a lot from it. 
I'm also graduated as a Nutritionist, so my passions really are Fashion, Beauty and Health. I'm now back in the Netherlands, and I'm pregnant with our first child! 
Do you want to see more? Please send an email so I can send you my portfolio! Would love to hear from you! - Emma

I moved to New York in September 2014, fulfilling one of my biggest and longest dreams. Before making the big move I spent the previous four/five years completing my Ph.D. in fashion branding at NUIG. 

LC’s Closet originally started out as a fashion blog to help me escape the stress of Ph.D. life. While still predominantly a personal style blog, since I waved goodbye to academic life and moved to the US my little spot in cyber space has grown to incorporate lifestyle and blog advice content too. So I guess the ‘closet’ now contains everything including the kitchen sink.

bio:

name: Sunny Gu
bio:
My name is Sunny Gu, a Los Angeles-based fashion & beauty illustrator. 

I have been commissioned by the likes of Condé Nast, Vogue Magazine, Teen Vogue, ELLE Magazine , InStyle, Bloomingdales, Macy's, Nordstrom, Versace, Dolce & Gabbana's Swide Magazine, Carolina Herrera, Brian Atwood, Express, South Coast Plaza, Beverly Center,The Grove, La Prairie, Shiseido, FANCL , Neutrogena and HBO among others. 

I was born and raised in China, I moved to the United States when I was 13. After encountering people from different backgrounds, I became very curious about other cultures. I learned to observe and discover beauties in everything around me. 

I wish to find a way to capture and preserve the beauties that I see, the kindness that I feel, and recreate them in someway. I decided to become an illustrator and artist. 

For most of my illustrations, I paint them in watercolor. I love the vibrancy and unpredictable nature of watercolor. Occasionally I use graphite or acrylic paint to render some special textures. I also create digital art for surface design and textiles. 

My illustrations are always full of vibrant colors, rich details and delightful feelings. My work, on the other hand, is an endless journey searching for beauty, value, truth and self. When I paint, I am bathed in happiness, I hope my colorful illustrations can bring you some joy too! 

Wish you a wonderful day! 

Sunny

name: TUESDAY VINTAGE ☆☆☆
bio:
Tuesday vintage is an online creative platform where founder and stylist, Rachel March showcases the innovative work of herself and other creatives alike whilst also doubling as a store selling unique fashion forward vintage pieces. 
Each piece has a story of it’s own - recycled, retold and relived in every new home that it enters. 

Born in 2012, Tuesday Vintage now ranges a wide variety of creative work including styling, full directed shoots, brand collaborations, lookbooks & design. 
Rachel’s extensive set of skills in styling are now being used to collaborate with the many artists in this world where they will then be featured on the blog, exposing viewers to upcoming trends and talent to keep an eye on. 

The store heavily relies on trend forecasts where the seasonal vintage buys reflect up to date fashion movements whilst remaining unique and one of a kind. 
Rachel’s coordination with designers, labels, style icons, photographers, bloggers and PR companies across the globe ensures that the shop will forever offer eccentric pieces like no other and the Tuesday Vintage platform will constantly be showcasing the best of the best. 

Much like most age old tales - there is a beginning, a middle and an end. 
For Tuesday Vintage, this is only the beginning. 

Thankful to everyone who has joined this wild adventure, Rachel truly believes it's all of the people she has met along the way that keeps this inspiration and magic growing.. ♡

name: Lindsi Lane•So|Lindsi
bio:
Lindsi Lane is on a mission to prove that with the right outfit, a good attitude and a sense of humor, anything is possible. The New York City-based writer is the founder of lifestyle website, SoLindsi.com, a carefully curated edit of personal stories, satirical commentary, and outfit inspiration. Lindsi draws upon her fashion background and straight-shooting persona to create Humor with a Sense of Style. 

The Indiana University-grad began her fashion career working for Gucci, Michael Kors, and Elle magazine, before becoming the youngest personal shopper in Barney’s New York history at age 23. She went on to form styling company, Lindsi Michelle Lane LLC, and was signed as the first ‘By Appointment’ stylist for Ford Artists NYC. Despite her successful styling career, Lindsi was eager to show others that personal style extends far beyond the clothing on your back. 

In 2015, she launched SoLindsi.com to connect with readers as a digital hybrid of their best friend and stylist. “Style is how you paint your blank canvas, but your voice is the essence of your personal style,” says Lindsi, who empowers readers with her quick-witted charm and honest content – think Sex and the City meets Amy Schumer. “My mission is to inspire people to be comfortable in their own skin, embrace who they are beyond the surface, and laugh along the way.” 

SoLindsi.com is a lifestyle website best known for its Humor with a Sense of Style. Creator, Lindsi Lane shares personal narratives, candid advice with her Ask Lindsi column, fashion finds, and relationship advice to help readers develop a bold, eccentric style that celebrates originality and cultivates confidence. Her witty perspective and relatable point of view sets the site apart from others in the digital space. SoLindsi.com offers behind-the-scenes access to Lindsi’s endless adventures and guides readers toward living the life of their dreams in style from the inside out.” 

Lindsi has been featured on CBS Live On The Couch, Fox5 Good Day New York, E!, Hollywood Life, ABC, MSN LIving, Life & Style Magazine, Glamour, PopSugar, New York Daily News and much more!

name: Ali Cavill
bio:
Ali is a Master Trainer, Holistic Health Expert, Motivational Speaker, Social Media Influencer and the Owner of Fit Fantastic, a leading fitness, health and wellness company. Her previous life as a corporate human resources executive within NSW Government was extensive and allowed her to climb the managerial ladder, however this fast and stressful pace eventually initiated a life and career change to pursue her lifelong passion for health and fitness. In creating Fit Fantastic, Ali has become a renowned “face'' of health and fitness that sees her travel the state delivering the important message to ‘Just Get Moving’ and motivating and encouraging everyone to achieve optimum health! 

During the week Ali is a Sports Teacher on Sydney’s northern beaches, a Development Officer for Netball NSW, a Group Fitness Instructor for Fitness First and a Mentor for upcoming fitness professionals. She is an accomplished Health & Fitness author and business writer and also finds time for her acting hobby, having held roles on Rake, Hyde and Seek, Home & Away, Biggest Loser, Here Come the Habibs, Fat Pizza and The Circle, to name a few! 

Ali works tirelessly in many ambassador and volunteer roles for various charities, community and other organisations as it is her belief that holistic health can heal us and that the tools to be healthy should be accessible to all. This includes work for Dementia Australia, CHeBA Centre for Health Brain Ageing (CHeBA) UNSW, Australian Institute of Fitness, Australian Fitness Network, RAISE Organisation, Australian Sports Nutrition (ASN), Motivation 2 Conquer and Rockwear Gymwear.

name: The Guiltless Foodies
bio:
When it comes to good food, Nishkala and Arvind are a couple with the ‘golden tongue’. They can not only taste (and discern culinary magic), but they can express themselves with precision and eloquence that is rare. Essentially they are media professionals who not only fell in love with each other but also with cuisine of all types. And as their love for each other grew, food became a passion for them! 

In May 2015, they gave birth to “The Guiltless Foodies” which expresses very aptly their zest for good food. Their adventurous spirit takes them to distant corners as they pursue their quest for culinary masterpieces. They have travelled ‘the road not taken’ to explore promising and upcoming food outlets. Very importantly they have covered all types of places from fine dine, mid level to small places that are way off the culinary circuit.

Their eagle eye for detail and discerning taste buds has played a pivotal role in mapping the ever changing culinary landscape of the city. They have travelled hundreds of kilometres to understand and relish good food and they are always gung ho about tasting and testing new food opportunities. It’s hardly a surprise to learn that they are the winner of “Best Restaurant Review” by the Food Blogger Association of India. 

Yes, this gourmand couple has many 'meals' to go before they sleep!

bio: I am a Gold Coast boy trying to make it in the big scary world of Art and tattooing. I have been Drawing, Painting and completing all kinds of art ever since I could hold my first pencil and paint brush. I love what I do and have a deep passion for all kinds of art. I have to say I love the feeling of accomplishing something from nothing, turning that white page or blank skin into a piece of art, a memory, that happy place or a piece of expression you love to look at. I would have to say the best part of my job is the look, the smile, the surprise and the overall feeling I see in people when I hand over that piece of art they have been wanting and been waiting for. I have to thank Sean, Doddy, Aaron and Starzy at Loco Tattoo studio for showing me the ropes and helping become the artist I am today, with out these guys I wouldn't be here.

These days, he works full time on his Washington D.C.-based men’s lifestyle and fashion blog, Diego Downtown and consulting with brands on social and digital initiatives and special projects. A D.C. resident for the past 5 years, Diego spends his time shopping (of course), attending food, fashion and lifestyle events, exploring the city with friends and traveling.

name: Beauty, Lifestyle & Travel Influencer
bio:
I am a media professional, makeup enthusiast and beauty & travel vlogger/blogger based in Buffalo, New York. I've been creating beauty-related content on YouTube for the past several years and enjoyed a great career in radio and television for over a decade. A thirty-something, internet-savvy, night owl, I love to travel and share my experiences through videos and posts. My passion for bargain shopping, beautifying things and social media marketing led to the creation of PrettyPRChickTV. 

PrettyPRChickTV is a rapidly growing Beauty and Affordable Luxury Adventure Travel channel focused on providing useful travel tips, inspiration and advice for a specific demographic. PrettyPRChickTV addresses the needs of women 18-34 who love looking stylish but don’t necessarily want to pay a fortune to keep up with the latest beauty and fashion trends. That includes a combination of new product reviews, shopping hauls, step-by-step tutorials, motivational tips and ideas on how to achieve a flawless look on a budget. The channel is dedicated to everything beauty, fashion and hair-related and features travel and exclusive event vlogs as well. PrettyPRChickTV loves to connect with like-minded people and cultivate transparent relationships between brands, bloggers and vloggers globally.

name: Rodrigo Alves
bio:
Rodrigo Alves became known worldwide for his courage in reinventing himself with the help of plastic surgery. This has given him the confidence to express himself with a unique fashion style, and has led him to be happy to enjoy life and a better lifestyle. He is now outgoing, charismatic, and a truly passionate ambassador for the subjects of body image, plastic surgery, fashion, body image bulling, and equality. 

Rodrigo Alves has appeared on 46 TV shows to date, including reality and documentary shows worldwide. Rodrigo's good expressive interpersonal and language skills enable him to reach various countries and cultures very successfully, sharing his experiences with plastic surgery, educating people from his own experiences, and also sharing his great sense of fashion. 

Rodrigo loves an excuse to party, and dresses elegantly to attend events and parties. He can be often seen in Las Vegas, Los Angeles, London and Puerto Banús hanging out with his group of friends always very chatty and charming. Rodrigo stands out not only for his unique but classic fashion style but also for his kind, warm and friendly personality which has won him fans all over the world.

Interested in working and collaborating with me? Any comments, questions, products sample, collaboration offers, sponsorship or anything, just reach me through an e-mail or twitter account﻿. Please tell me by sending your email to deluxshionist@gmail.com or mention me via twitter @HerdianaHS

name: Emma
bio:
Hi you! My name is Emma and I'm 25 years old. I'm born and raised in The Netherlands. I'm having MS & Lyme Disease and I'm traveling the world for treatments. While doing treatments I'm more determined than ever to rise and shine, and definitely not letting my diseases define me. I did a lot of collaborations for over the past years, and I think because of my illnesses I am a really hard working woman and not letting ANYTHING come in my way if I want to achieve it. I want to show my followers that Fashion is fun and you can do so much with it, as well with beauty and health products. 
What you see is what you get with me, my previous clients from collaborations were immediately positive when I send them my pictures, and I'm always updating them whenever I got the product and if I'm having pictures ready etc. I'm doing everything myself, from the creative part of where to shoot, the modeling part, the editing, just everything you can think of. 
For different treatments for my health, I lived in Florida (Tampa/Clearwater Beach Area) and in Los Angeles. I loved living in such different cities, it inspires me and I learned a lot from it. 
I'm also graduated as a Nutritionist, so my passions really are Fashion, Beauty and Health. I'm now back in the Netherlands, and I'm pregnant with our first child! 
Do you want to see more? Please send an email so I can send you my portfolio! Would love to hear from you! - Emma

name: Sunny Gu
bio:
My name is Sunny Gu, a Los Angeles-based fashion & beauty illustrator. 

I have been commissioned by the likes of Condé Nast, Vogue Magazine, Teen Vogue, ELLE Magazine , InStyle, Bloomingdales, Macy's, Nordstrom, Versace, Dolce & Gabbana's Swide Magazine, Carolina Herrera, Brian Atwood, Express, South Coast Plaza, Beverly Center,The Grove, La Prairie, Shiseido, FANCL , Neutrogena and HBO among others. 

I was born and raised in China, I moved to the United States when I was 13. After encountering people from different backgrounds, I became very curious about other cultures. I learned to observe and discover beauties in everything around me. 

I wish to find a way to capture and preserve the beauties that I see, the kindness that I feel, and recreate them in someway. I decided to become an illustrator and artist. 

For most of my illustrations, I paint them in watercolor. I love the vibrancy and unpredictable nature of watercolor. Occasionally I use graphite or acrylic paint to render some special textures. I also create digital art for surface design and textiles. 

My illustrations are always full of vibrant colors, rich details and delightful feelings. My work, on the other hand, is an endless journey searching for beauty, value, truth and self. When I paint, I am bathed in happiness, I hope my colorful illustrations can bring you some joy too! 

Wish you a wonderful day! 

Sunny

name: TUESDAY VINTAGE ☆☆☆
bio:
Tuesday vintage is an online creative platform where founder and stylist, Rachel March showcases the innovative work of herself and other creatives alike whilst also doubling as a store selling unique fashion forward vintage pieces. 
Each piece has a story of it’s own - recycled, retold and relived in every new home that it enters. 

Born in 2012, Tuesday Vintage now ranges a wide variety of creative work including styling, full directed shoots, brand collaborations, lookbooks & design. 
Rachel’s extensive set of skills in styling are now being used to collaborate with the many artists in this world where they will then be featured on the blog, exposing viewers to upcoming trends and talent to keep an eye on. 

The store heavily relies on trend forecasts where the seasonal vintage buys reflect up to date fashion movements whilst remaining unique and one of a kind. 
Rachel’s coordination with designers, labels, style icons, photographers, bloggers and PR companies across the globe ensures that the shop will forever offer eccentric pieces like no other and the Tuesday Vintage platform will constantly be showcasing the best of the best. 

Much like most age old tales - there is a beginning, a middle and an end. 
For Tuesday Vintage, this is only the beginning. 

Thankful to everyone who has joined this wild adventure, Rachel truly believes it's all of the people she has met along the way that keeps this inspiration and magic growing.. ♡

name: Lindsi Lane•So|Lindsi
bio:
Lindsi Lane is on a mission to prove that with the right outfit, a good attitude and a sense of humor, anything is possible. The New York City-based writer is the founder of lifestyle website, SoLindsi.com, a carefully curated edit of personal stories, satirical commentary, and outfit inspiration. Lindsi draws upon her fashion background and straight-shooting persona to create Humor with a Sense of Style. 

The Indiana University-grad began her fashion career working for Gucci, Michael Kors, and Elle magazine, before becoming the youngest personal shopper in Barney’s New York history at age 23. She went on to form styling company, Lindsi Michelle Lane LLC, and was signed as the first ‘By Appointment’ stylist for Ford Artists NYC. Despite her successful styling career, Lindsi was eager to show others that personal style extends far beyond the clothing on your back. 

In 2015, she launched SoLindsi.com to connect with readers as a digital hybrid of their best friend and stylist. “Style is how you paint your blank canvas, but your voice is the essence of your personal style,” says Lindsi, who empowers readers with her quick-witted charm and honest content – think Sex and the City meets Amy Schumer. “My mission is to inspire people to be comfortable in their own skin, embrace who they are beyond the surface, and laugh along the way.” 

SoLindsi.com is a lifestyle website best known for its Humor with a Sense of Style. Creator, Lindsi Lane shares personal narratives, candid advice with her Ask Lindsi column, fashion finds, and relationship advice to help readers develop a bold, eccentric style that celebrates originality and cultivates confidence. Her witty perspective and relatable point of view sets the site apart from others in the digital space. SoLindsi.com offers behind-the-scenes access to Lindsi’s endless adventures and guides readers toward living the life of their dreams in style from the inside out.” 

Lindsi has been featured on CBS Live On The Couch, Fox5 Good Day New York, E!, Hollywood Life, ABC, MSN LIving, Life & Style Magazine, Glamour, PopSugar, New York Daily News and much more!

name: Erika, Founder/Owner of YCS
bio:
Erika L. McDaniel, Founder and Owner, Your Chic is Showing, LLC 

Erika McDaniel is the founder/owner of Your Chic is Showing, LLC, which offers personal styling and personal shopping services, as well as a fashion and lifestyle blog of the same name. Erika offers personal styling and shopping services to male and female clients, which have included up-and-coming professionals, models, and professional athletes. Erika also contributes to Bourgeoisie Magazine as a Fashion Consultant. 

In her spare time, Erika has served on the Board of Directors and held leadership positions for numerous organizations including A Better Chance – Radnor (Radnor ABC), The Tripod Foundation Inc., and Upper Merion – King of Prussia Relay for Life. Erika currently serves on the Board of Trustees for the Forman S. Acton Educational Foundation, Leadership Committee of Young Life Urban Philadelphia, the Selection Committee for Radnor ABC and as a mentor at the GESU School. She has also volunteered with a number of groups including the SEI Cares Board of Directors, Habitat for Humanity, The Beautillion and Kappa League of Burlington-Camden Alumni Chapter of Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity, Inc. and the DC Summer Youth Employment Program. Erika is a 2005 cum laude graduate of Howard University and has also worked in the finance industry since that time.

name: Ilkay Sky
bio:
Ilkay Sky is an international entrepreneur and an innovative leader in the Fitness, Health & Wellness Industry. 

Ilkay was born in Istanbul, Turkey in 1990. He resided in Istanbul till he was 13 years old, where he participated in various team sports together with individual performance sports. 

In 2003, he moved to Barcelona, Spain with his family. He concentrated on excelling at basketball with the goal of playing for FC Barcelona Basquet and simultaneously competed in an amateur full contact kick boxing league. 

In 2006, via a self-initiated weight cut, he found cysts on his body that needed to be surgically removed as the tissues could potentially carry cancer cells. Following the operation, he then noticed an abnormality on his left leg. What appeared to be a harsh bruise turned out to be a bone tumor on his left femur. 

After a successful 7-hour surgery, the large tumor was removed and the femur was reinforced with a strip of cadaver bone. The operation rendered Ilkay unable to move without walking aids for the duration of two years. Doctors told him he may never be able to walk again. 

Ilkay refused to accept the fate that was instilled by the doctors and heavily invested his time in rehab. In 2010, he decided to move to Montreal to continue his BCOMM education at a prestigious business school in Montreal, JMSB of Concordia University. 

He fully recovered from his operation and decided to take up martial arts. The relentless effort displayed by Ilkay led him to become a very talented mixed martial artist after 3 years of consistent training for over 4 hours (on average) a day. With the aid of his instructors, Sifu Sebastien and Kru Ryan Parsons, he started teaching mixed martial arts to others. He is currently training to fight at a heavier weight class. 

On the business side, Ilkay has worked in a variety of industries, such as retail & wholesale jewelry, interior design, electronics manufacturing services, SaaS, and the Fitness & Wellness industry. He assumed positions in Sales, Business Development, and Customer Success in the companies he worked with. 

Using his knowledge and experience gathered throughout his lifetime via practicing various types of functional and strength based sports, he has created the world’s most balanced training methodology, LIBRAFORTE.

name: missfashionnews
bio:
Traveling the online and offline world 24/7 to share the latest trends, news, shows & inside scoops with my loyal readers and followers…MissFashionNews! 

My life evolves around high-end fashion, the haute couture and beauty, a passion and lifestyle I enthusiastically love to share. From NYC to Beijing and from Paris to Milan and London, no matter what it takes, MissFashionNews is ready to cover it all, either by Tweets, Instagram, Facebook or by sharing journalistic reports. Preferably all above! 

Although Amsterdam is my hometown, I'm always on the move, strutting along the waves of the wonderous world of fashion, beauty and haute couture, no matter where the stream takes me. I do consider myself to be one of the lucky few who has access to this magical scenery of inspirational creations. All the more reason to make sure that my readers get the true vibe of every event, store opening, couture & ready-to-wear show, product or place I attend, from A to Z. 
After freelancing for several online fashion, beauty and lifestyle platforms as well as print magazines, I wanted to create a more personal online world with more creative writing depth as I am not a big fan of the 'oh, look at me and my gazillion filters' selfies world. With a lot of goodwill, help and encouragement from my friends and professionals in the fashion industry, MissFashionNews successfully launched July 2011. 

A few online and printed press articles featuring myself and my website MissFashionNews include: Grazia NL, newspaper De Telegraaf, Good2B, World of Fashion Blogs, BMI Yeah Baby Inflight Magazine, Fashion Monitor, Time Out Magazine, Fashion TV, BackstageFashionReporters 
MissFashionNews blogposts have mentions and features on: The Hufftington Post, TrendHunter, Fashion Daily Mag, Miracle Skin Transformer, Moon Company, Runway Passport, The Monitor (Dallas), Retail Design blog, Milli Millu, Tosca Blu, xIdea USA, Vancouver Sun, On Aura Tout Vu, Andrew GN, Ragazze Ornamentali, Beaute Pacifique, Alexandre Boulais, Kafkaesque, Faces of New York Fashion Week, Ankar Sweden, Gomes Esser, Fashion avec Passion, Fashion United, Fashion Monitor, TVHPR Los Angeles, Julien Fournie, Sergio Davila, Mathieu Mirano, Sanjay Ramcharan, Musette Paris, AOL BoomBox, Style Updatez, Fashions Digest, Co/Motion, PRBB, Aveda, Jet Set Fashion Magazine, ShowStudio, FashionCourier, UBIFRANCE - the French Trade Commission, Frédérique Constant, Lashem, Rossy de Palma, Fashion and Textile Museum (London), Faces of New York Fashion Week, Pulleez, Patrick McMullan Photography, Reem Acra, NATAN, Glamorama, Emma's Amazing Fun(d) Raising, The Scent Company, Aziz, Luxesco, SociusLive, Nobile 1947, The Fader (Lacoste SS15), Metro Tv News, Inglot USA, Star Style, Dazed Magazine, Fashion United NL, Schuim (Het Parool), Decimononic.com, Parfumo.de, KCD, Miss Nederland 2016, Ambas Italy 

For any inquiries, invites, press releases, collaborations, branded content and/or product reviews, please don't hesitate to contact me at 
press@missfashionnews.com

name: francopugifirenze
bio: The Italian brand FrancoPugi was founded in the 1970’s by the young and creative entrepreneur Franco Pugi. Pugi came from a family of industrialists involved in the textile industry therefore opening a door for him into the fashion world. Franco began his career driven by his passion and desire to revisit the authenticity of Italian craftsmanship and expertise. The company logo, two galloping horses, was designed to represent the successful collaboration between Franco and his wife Elena in both life and work. During the 80’s and 90’s the business grew exponentially and the FrancoPugi brand achieved great recognition for its bags and accessories not only in Italy but in America and Japan as well. Having achieved much success Franco and his family decided to make their home in South America. After being away for ten years and with much encouragement from his daughter, Lara, Franco felt that it was time to return to Italy to relaunch the business. With great enthusiasm, energy and the support of a talented team Franco is inspired to realize his many projects and dreams. Franco Pugi bags with their original designs are colorful and versatile making them attractive to women all over the world. They carry the “Made in Italy” label as they are handmade with great care and attention to detail by Italian artisans.

name: Addicted to Lace | Roshni Chaudhari
bio:
A 20-something fashion enthusiast from Mumbai, India; founder Roshni Chaudhari was always a business student until she found the perfect degree to combine it with her one true love, fashion. Armed with a fashion marketing and management degree, she writes for her blog and other fashion brands as well. 
The blog, AddictedtoLace.com, is Roshni’s attempt at finding her voice amid the chaos all around her. She aims to share tidbits of her personal style, with a strong focus on high street brands and start-ups, and discuss the various sources of inspiration and learning all around. The goal is to explore the business, the history, the social and cultural elements, the economic influences, the people – everything that goes into making fashion what it is.

bio:

When she is not crafting charitable ventures, she is immersed in capturing + sharing her life one instagram and blog post at a time. With an immense passion for fashion, travel, lifestyle, and cooking, June created a blog to share her adventures and inspire others to find the wild girl within themselves so they can do the same. 

Within a short time of starting her blog, June Johnson has collaborated on well-received partnership work from brands such as Pantene, Tobi, Burger King, Dick's Sporting Goods, etc. Her candid, original and innovative style has paved a way for this rising star to continue producing digital content that is bold, visually artistic and exactly what high-end brands are searching for.

I was able to get my feet wet with clientele at my sister's salon when I lived up north. 
I've been gratefully given the opportunities to work on weddings, proms, special occasions and even Charlotte fashion show. Hopefully much more  
I feel like it's my job to prove to my kids that you need to follow your heart and do what truly makes you happy. Know your self worth and don't settle for just anything. Life's about taking chances!

bio:
I am a all about creative crafts and entertainment. With my passion for fashion, beauty, music, and modeling I created a blog to share my journey as well as inspire others to do the same. Being from Baltimore I felt the need to show my peers that your dreams are tangible. 

I am a Cosmo girl on my day to day. Soon to put a be a certified stylist in hair, nails, skin care, & makeup. I use the right side (the creative side) of my brain daily. Being with my Cosmo squad has given me the opportunity to be on WJZ news. This is my newest endeavor. 

My love for being a singer/songwriter is really where my heart is. I originally got started by agreeing to do a feature with Baltimore to Atlanta rapper @410JNO. Shortly after moving on to do my own music. I fell in love with the creative freedom. I've featured on different local artists projects. I have realeased music of my own via iTunes Spotify Google Play etc .In return have opened doors for my passion for modeling. 

My passion for modeling started as young as a middle schooler. I've done runway shows, tv segments, music videos, skits, promotional events, and lots of different print. I've done a hair show for Mrs. Donna B a senior cosmetologist, educator, and owner of many salons. I've done a tv segment for Brenda L Jones clothing via Hotel RL Tv. I've done a catalog list of music videos whether I was a pop up artist or being a lead vixen. I was one of the leading models beside D.C.'s own Ashley Z in 100 Grandman's "100" video which was featured on BET. I've done promotional events for brands like The Purple Peach Bar and Frapachatta. I've also done print and promo for Mogul Printing for many events. I include the people around me in every aspect of fashion, beauty, modeling, and music.

bio:

When I’m not working or studying, I like to go to Orange Theory with my husband, curl up on the couch with a good book, or watch suspenseful sci-fi movies. I also really love a good cheese dip and I whole-heartedly believe Sunday afternoons were made for napping. 

I believe a woman’s wardrobe is her opportunity to stand out and make a lasting impression. I have always enjoyed fashion, beauty, and branching out to find my own unique sense of style. Clothes have always made me FEEL something so I created this blog as a fun way to share my style and inspiration with all of you. Over the years I have saved up and invested in a handful of couture pieces but I believe that fashion is for every woman and all body types, especially those of us who aren’t size 2 runway models. name: Erika, Founder/Owner of YCS
bio:
Erika L. McDaniel, Founder and Owner, Your Chic is Showing, LLC 

Erika McDaniel is the founder/owner of Your Chic is Showing, LLC, which offers personal styling and personal shopping services, as well as a fashion and lifestyle blog of the same name. Erika offers personal styling and shopping services to male and female clients, which have included up-and-coming professionals, models, and professional athletes. Erika also contributes to Bourgeoisie Magazine as a Fashion Consultant. 

In her spare time, Erika has served on the Board of Directors and held leadership positions for numerous organizations including A Better Chance – Radnor (Radnor ABC), The Tripod Foundation Inc., and Upper Merion – King of Prussia Relay for Life. Erika currently serves on the Board of Trustees for the Forman S. Acton Educational Foundation, Leadership Committee of Young Life Urban Philadelphia, the Selection Committee for Radnor ABC and as a mentor at the GESU School. She has also volunteered with a number of groups including the SEI Cares Board of Directors, Habitat for Humanity, The Beautillion and Kappa League of Burlington-Camden Alumni Chapter of Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity, Inc. and the DC Summer Youth Employment Program. Erika is a 2005 cum laude graduate of Howard University and has also worked in the finance industry since that time.

name: Kingdomz X Magazine
bio:
It's been my life-long conviction that art represents the imprint of the human soul upon the material world. 

While often a highly individualistic and personal vision formed within and shaped by its unique vessel - the artist - the manifestation of art itself is essentially a tangible snapshot of our collective subconscious. 

It is this conviction that impelled me to create this magazine in order to showcase an eclectic array of art as a sort of tapestry, whether in the guise of: fine art, craft of artisans, performance phenomena, or pop culture diversions. 

My selections gathered there will be those which I find exhibit particular resonance deserving of continued examination & discussion, since this is the means by which we preserve and transmit our cultural identity. 

After all, great art doesn't stand the test of time simply by virtue of its obvious quality, it does so because art moves us enough to keep it alive in our admiration and conversation. Thus it is we, ourselves who transport art through time. 

The objective of Kingdomz X Magazine is to ignite passion and to stimulate that positive, mind-blowing feeling that fuels each one of us to create.

Along with that, I provide services to assist whether personal, collaborative, or business base to elevate another. 

I have a passion for exploration, discovering new ways to create and define substance in a new light. My brand is beyond Fashion; it designs environments for creatives alike, or those who aspire to be, to network, form friendships, and build a support system. name: ourtimeofthemonth
bio:
HI, WE’RE CAITLIN & DANIELLE 

Together we're Our Time of the Month, a blogging and vlogging duo with a focus on all things beauty, booze, food and lifestyle. We created Our Time of the Month so that we could discuss our everyday interests and concerns, including self-care, birth control, relationships, the perfect summer rosé, and everything in between. 

OUR BLOG & YOUTUBE CHANNEL 

Don't let the name fool you--we're not just periods. Whether you need suggestions for the best long wear lipstick, want to know where to find an affordable floral jumpsuit, have questions about your first bikini wax, or just want to learn how to craft a delicious spring cocktail, Our Time of the Month has you covered. 

OTM has built quite the Girl Gang as 86% of our Instagram followers and 100% of our YouTube viewers are women. 80% of our total audience is comprised of women aged 25-34. Our viewers look to us for honest opinions and reviews, and we never hesitate to give the dish on our must have products, best tips, or top restaurants.

name: Haritini Pandis
bio: I have created PhiLuxthropy which is my own founded terminology of combining luxury real estate, philanthropy, fashion lifestyle into one. This enables three different markets to link together as one and create a different approach on how someone views what luxury truly embodies, calling it PhiLuxthropy. PhiLuxthropy allows people to list their properties with me, in exchange I will contribute a percentage of my commission towards charitable causes and non profit organizations under their names, which is also tax deductible. This allows the client to enjoy life's luxurious pleasures while helping those less fortunate. It's a new humane approach on how I'd love to interact with various brands as well, whether it be fashion, which I will promote while I'm running on appointments and events, all the way to household products, furniture, and anything real estate related which can be used by my clients/viewers and others interested in products of choice. PhiLuxthropy is the way to go.

name: Rhea ( ree-uh )
bio:
Rhea 's blog is all about fashion from her point of view, at only 4'11" she likes to relate to all the other petite women and mom's who also adore fashion. As a stay-at-home mom and wife, no matter what you're doing or going, you can always look fabulous on a budget! She likes to share her insight's about style and also the people she meets in the fashion industry. Empowering and following her dreams is a major part of her blog's agenda. She's always been a creative person, loves to sew and crochet, collect fabrics and magazines, loves to go to the museum to find inspiration. Most importantly, Rhea loves spending time with her family, she is also a wife, and mom to 2 adorable kids, so from time to time you will see a post about them and about family life. 
Background: Rhea had a unique life style growing up. She always loved art and fashion ever since she was a little girl. She's worked for a Radio Station WOR 710AM, where she would share her back to school shopping tips and what's on trend for the upcoming season. In 2003, her first internship was for Betsey Johnson where she was the youngest candidate since she was only in high school at the time. Usually only college students were allowed to intern but Rhea did amazing on her interview, and they took her in right away. 
Rhea's also interned for Vivienne Tam (2003) and Cosmopolitan Magazine (2007). 
Rhea's been in and out of the fashion industry giving her time to help out during Mercedez Benz Fashion Week in New York behind the scenes. She's helped out in shows for Isaac Mizrahi, Monique Lhuiller, Vera Wang, Betsey Johnson, Anna Sui, Nicole Miller, Tracy Reese, and Venexiana. 
2011 She finally got to attend her first fashion show at Mercedes Benz Fashion Week in New York and it was for I C B by Prabal Gurung. She got to sit in the second row as an attendee and it hit her that she actually didn't have to work a show for the first time. It was a great feeling and accomplishment since she's always dreamed of being an attendee. Rhea then started Sew Stylish Rhea to share her sewing projects, her passion for fashion from her personal style, fabric shopping, and fashion/beauty events she attends. In 2013 she collaborated with The Mobile Media Lab and Insta Meet for New York Fashion Week, where she was one of the selected Instagrammer's to attend Tommy Hilfiger's Fall 2014 Fashion show. She got to take pictures of behind the scenes and capture images of the fashion show, meet Tommy in person too which was also a wonderful experience.

After spending three years in San Francisco completing my Master of Fine Arts in Fashion, I moved to Los Angeles in 2014 to pursue my career as a stylist and in 2015 I transplanted back to Nashville. I specialize in celebrity, commercial, editorial and ECommerce styling and more recently I've begun food styling. 

As a wardrobe stylist, I have worked as a lead stylist with Tim McGraw, Garth Brooks, Chris Stapleton, Greyson + Reed and Riley Clemmons, Honda and Electric Jukebox. I have assisted Joseph Cassell with his client Taylor Swift and Tiffany Gifford with her clients Miranda Lambert, Maddie & Tae, Lee Ann Womack, Martina McBride, Ashley Monroe, RaeLynn as well as working on projects for Shania Twain. I have also styled for Saks Off 5th ECommerce. 

For all inquiries, feel free to email me 

Thank you!

name: Candy Clothing
bio:
Candy Clothing is an International company, with a Unique, Sweet Themed, Quirky, Yummy and affordable scrumptious fashion style of clothing and accessories. 

We are based in London UK, was founded in April 2013 and have been seen in UK Glamour Magazine and Look Magazine, as well as the Daily Star, and many others. 

Our brand is loved by many celebrities, music artists, radio presenters and TV personalities including contestants from BBC The Voice UK, X Factor, Celebrity Big Brother, MTV Ex On The Beach, ITV2 Love Island to name a few. 

We have gained interest from music artists/bands such as Little Mix, That Poppy, Christina Milan, Alexandra Burke, Alexa Goddard, Stooshe, Miley Cyrus Tour Dancers and other artists signed to established record labels from Island Records, Epic Records, Roc Nation, Sony Music and all have totally fallen in love with our scrumptious collection. 

As we have a sweet appetite, anything to do with sugar/food we like to create clothing and accessories based on a sweet theme. 

We also like to add catchy slogans on our clothing. So, if you have a sweet tooth like we do, then you're definitely at the right place. 

​Candy Clothing is open to people of all ages, race and gender. Everyone is welcome to enjoy, purchase, wear and support Candy Clothing. 

A donation of £1 will be donated to The Children For Peace Charity from each item that is sold via our Candy Clothing online store.

name: Natural Mumma
bio:
Natural Mumma Magazine is the ethical fashion, natural beauty and conscious lifestyle title for women who care. Out on the first Friday of each month, featuring the best slow fashion, organic skincare and sustainable brands as well as features on ecology, parenting, good eating and wellbeing. In addition to the monthly digital magazine, we share articles, reviews, insights and news stories on our website. We also produce films of our unique recipes and produce regular gift guides to showcase and celebrate our favourite eco-friendly and sustainable products. 

At Natural Mumma we love good food, great style and beautiful objects that don’t cost the earth. We believe in clean beauty, chemical free skincare and limiting our exposure to harmful toxins. 

We accept that being the best we can be is the only sort of perfection worth striving for, and when it comes to lifestyle choices there are limits to what can be achieved. We love the sense of story that comes with an ethical lifestyle; from knowing the origins of a garment to expressing your own character through your individual style – ethical fashion doesn’t just mean quality, it connects us to the global community. You can keep your carbon footprint small, even in the most beautiful footwear. We believe that every day is worthy of red lipstick, especially when it has been made with thought and consideration. 

Natural Mumma was founded by Holly Daffurn, whose journalistic career spans across beauty, fashion, art, music and travel. Holly’s book ‘The Natural Baby: A gentle guide to conception, pregnancy, birth & beyond’ was published internationally by Green Books in 2017 and takes the reader through a healthy pregnancy through yoga, healthy eating and reducing dangerous chemicals. She has also written several ebooks around parenting, miscarriage and separation (also published by Green Books). Holly’s experience includes being an official vlogger for Channel Mum and a columnist for The Green Parent Magazine. Before becoming editor in chief of Natural Mumma Magazine she wrote for a wealth of publications including Natural Health, Parents Magazine, The Ecologist, My Green Pod (a supplement of The Guardian) and DIVA.

name: Ashlee Rexroth
bio:
From a young age, the idea of being a part of the beauty industry always excited me. During high school, I decided to go through a program where I was allowed to attend high school part time and cosmetology part time. I was very fortunate to be able to graduate with my high school diploma and cosmetology license. I was craving more so I packed my bags and moved to Chicago to attend Makeup First School where I became a Certified makeup artist. That was just not enough for me so I proceeded to enroll myself in Tricoci University's Esthetician program, so I am now a licensed esthetician. 

I have been trained in various forms of makeup applications: color theory, high-definition, theatrical, beauty, media, wedding, runway/fashion, clinical, special FX, and editorial. I have a fun and loving attitude and enjoy using makeup to highlight your features and enhance your natural beauty. name: Alex // Stylelista Confessions
bio:
. Ever since I can remember my life has revolved around fashion. I picked up my first Vogue Magazine at age six and spent more time worrying about my outfit and when I could go shopping again then anything else. As a Southern California native I was always surrounded by fashion but it wasn't until my family relocated to Houston that I really knew I had found my calling. I did my first internship at Nordstrom at age 17 and then headed off to college to major in Fashion Marketing. As I was halfway through my degree I realized that my love of fashion was too much to NOT share it with the world and Stylelista Confessions was born. 

Now seven years later, I am living in the crazy city of Los Angeles working full time in marketing and continuing my love of blogging full time as well. My goal for this blog was to share all the amazing things I love in the world of fashion but also finding the alternative that is attainable for myself and I continue to do that in each and every post I share. I want everyone to leave knowing exactly how to embrace their inner stylelista! I love hearing from my readers, who are the ones that make this blog possible, so PLEASE give me a shout out I would love to hear from you!

name: Christopher Chapheau
bio:
Toronto based entrepreneur, health and fitness advocate, voracious reader and passionate advocate of men's style and fashion. 

My business partner and I brought the global market leader in IV therapy and booster shot wellness treatments, REVIV, to Canada. Two years ago we launched our first flagship clinic on King West and have quickly grown to become Toronto's #1 destination for IV therapy with location #2 opening in Toronto's Financial District in the fall. 

We then opened up King West's top skincare clinic, Skinhealth King West (@skinhealthclinic) which will be joining REVIV in our second location in the Financial district of Toronto. 

My next business expansion is into the app development world with a project currently under way with a small team specializes in ML models (machine learning) 

I've competed in fitness competitions and played competitive level rugby most of my life, self development is my passion. I'm always interested in working with brands that share my principles and values to help others elevate their quality of life by living their best selves.

name: Evan Reynolds
bio:
Formerly a professional ballet dancer, most recently with The Suzanne Farrell Ballet, Evan Reynolds began his career in fashion as a stylist, starting as an assistant and working his way up to conceptualizing, styling, and creative direction on several editorials. Evan has styled store campaigns and fashion stories published in Vogue, The Rakish Gent, Sarasota Magazine, and Style Magazine. Shortly after beginning his career as a stylist, he entered into the retail fashion world as an assistant womenswear buyer and marketing director for The Met, an independent luxury multi-brand store in Sarasota, FL. During his 3.5 years at The Met, Evan assisted in the women’s ready-to-wear and accessories department buying process with trips to fashion week for brands such as Alberta Ferretti, Carven, Peter Pilotto, Rag & Bone, and Ralph Lauren. He was responsible for creating and executing marketing strategies that coordinated print, social media and e-mail advertising, stemming from conceptualizing and directing The Met’s campaign photoshoots as well as the development of a newly launched website in November 2014; Evan was the editor of themetsarasota.com and The Met’s blog, The Met Edit. 

Evan has since moved back to his hometown of Milwaukee, WI, where he is finishing his minor in French Business from the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee, and splits his time between Chicago and Milwaukee. Evan will be applying to schools to finish his major in January 2017. 

SPOKEN FOR launched in August 2016 under the notion that style can be spoken for by all of us. This digital venture was created to inspire in many aspects: fashion, style, lifestyle, interior design & architecture, health & nutrition, music, and much more. We welcome you to join us on this sartorial journey to what is bohemian, cool, and luxurious.
